title: thornmail
body: Thornmail is stupid and makes it impossible for adcs to do their jobs without specifically building for it in such a way that doesn't allow them to do any real damage anyway. its too cheap for how powerful it is and should either be reworked with the vanguard update or removed.

> if your an adc whats the point of have 300 + ad if your going to get blown up in a second if you go within auto attack range.

So much this.

All the time I see ADCs and APCs building "glass canon" and then getting sh!tty when they get insta-killed by an assassin, which is supposed to be able to insta-kill anyone or anything that has 0 defence. People need to learn that full damage builds are innately flawed and start adapting to how things are happening in the current META. A couple (or a few) hybrid damage/defence items aren't going to hurt.

I blame a number of factors for this:

- Mobility creep (unless your team is on point with their peel, you really can't get in auto range safely)
- Assassin meta (assassins are too strong right now and I'd be fine if my favourite assassins were nerfed hard so long as the entire class gets nerfed)
- Earlygame champions not falling off as hard as they used to thanks to number changes and item changes making base damages more relevant, i.e. the rise of flat armour pen and it's replacement lethality
- Games being made far more snowbally, with firstblood tower gold, increased importance of dragon (dragons are weaker and worth more in the long run).
- Tank meta (personally I think this more about tank items than tanks themselves but I guess we'll see in the tank class update since I find I can build some assassins with 4 tank items and still be able to burst an adc and ruin their day, the assassin base damage catchup mechanics are stupid)
- The traditional adc items are too expensive for the earlygame meta and in a lategame 5-6 item build, adc's still don't really do much damage and often just get assassinated well before they can output their damage.
- Lategame Adcs autos don't actually do as much as people think they do and their dps lategame isn't that much different from most mages who have a bit of magic pen.

yep or have some ap on your team and just accept that you won't be able to fight the tank without some peel until you get your full build. Thornmail is 100 armour, sounds like alot but if you don't have the health to back it up, it's pretty underwhelming.

tbh I don't see many people building thornmail unless the the enemy team comp is like 5 ad champions or at least 3 atkspeed champs. It's not a very good item in this assassin/tank and a few mages meta. Adcs just aren't threatening enough to need this item and given that half the meta adcs aren't atkspeed based, this item is very lackluster since the damage back is negated lategame by lifesteal, so it's a midgame item, that doesn't have health attached to it, which makes it very hard to be a proper tank against a mixed damage enemy team if you buy it first or second (although for rammus this is an exception as he scales excellently with thornmails statline and you should avoid autoing him when he's in defense curl). Also the lack of health makes this a terrible first item rush.

Thornmail can be useful and it has a fair chunk of armour, but if survivability is your issue right now as a tank, randuins is far better for subduing adcs since tank base damages plus the overall reduction of damage output a randuins can do to an adc, means you'll fare far better trying to tank the damage.

Randuins >>> Thornmail for a tank in most cases, since the extra health makes this item overall tankier during the midgame, it's a decent first item for a tank if you aren't doing amazing and the atkspeed debuff coldsteel and the crit damage reduction go a long way into cutting an adcs damage output. Not to mention the randuins slow is more useful than you'll notice but it helps.

Thornmail makes you very vulnerable to magic damage and doesn't really help once the adc has gotten a bloodthirster.

The atkspeed debuffs from frozen heart and randuins don't synergise well with thormail but when measuring up which way to build, the atkspeed debuff ends up scaling better into lategame and make it harder for adcs during teamfights to get their dps out.

Just with the passives, not even factoring the armour, assuming the adc has 50% crit chance that's around 30% of your adc dps from autos, gone, before I even have to consider armour.
